item.title: Suggestions for Protocol and Security Enhancements for the Network Time Protocol
item.description: David L. Mills (author) Harlan Stenn (editor) Abstract This memo suggests protocol and security enhancements for the Network Time Protocol (NTP) described in RFC 5905, along with a replacement for the Autokey security scheme described in RFC 5906. The primary goals in this memo are to improve synchronization accuracy in all protocol modes. Secondary goals include improved resistance to wiretap and middleman attacks that exploit weaknesses in the error detection and recovery procedures.
